009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Arrays;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
018import imagingbook.common.mser.MserData;
019import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
020
021/**
022 * This class is a re-implementation of the "quasi-linear-time" component
023 * tree algorithm which is based on efficient, tree-based union finding as described in 
024 * L. Vincent and P. Soille, "Watersheds in digital spaces: An efficient 
025 * algorithm based on immersion simulations", IEEE Transactions on 
026 * Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence 13(6), 583â€“598 (1991).
027 * This algorithm is used in the original MSER paper by Matas et al. (2004).
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 *
031 * @param <T> the type of properties to be attached to components
032 */
033public class ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion<T> extends ComponentTree<T> {
034        
035        private final Collection<Component<T>> components;
036        private final Component<T> root;
037        
038        /**
039         * Constructor. Creates a new component tree from a {@link PixelMap}
040         * representing a gray-level image.
041         * @param pm a {@link PixelMap}
042         */
043        public ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion(PixelMap pm) {
044                root = collectComponents(pm);
045                components = new ArrayList<>();
046                buildTree();
047        }
048        
049        @Override
050        public Component<T> getRoot() {
051                return root;
052        }
053
054        @Override
055        public Collection<Component<T>> getComponents() {
056                return components;
057        }
058        
059        // ------------------------------------------------------------
060        
061        /**
062         * Collects all image pixels (in sorted order) and creates a preliminary
063         * component tree whose root is returned.
064         * 
065         * @param P a {@link PixelMap} (the input image)
066         * @return
067         */
068        private Component<T> collectComponents(PixelMap P) {
069                final Pixel[] Q = P.getPixelVector();
070                Arrays.sort(Q);         // sorts pixels in P by increasing gray-level (value)
071                
072                final ComponentMap<T> C = new ComponentMap<T>(P.width, P.height);
073                Component<T> r = null;                  // root of the component tree
074                
075                for (Pixel p : Q) {
076                        Component<T> cp = C.makeComponent(p); // creates a new sub-tree (with cp as root)
077                        Pixel n = p.getNextNeighbor();
078                        while (n != null) {
079                                Component<T> cn = C.getComponent(n);
080                                if (cn != null) {
081                                        // the neighbor component is already part of a tree)
082                                        // find the associated roots
083                                        Component<T> rp = cp.findRoot();        // root of p
084                                        Component<T> rn = cn.findRoot();        // root of n
085
086                                        if(rp != rn) {  // p and n have different roots
087                                                if (rp.getLevel() == rn.getLevel() &&  rp.getHeight() < rn.getHeight()) {
088                                                        // n's root becomes the parent of p's root
089                                                        join(rp, rn);
090                                                        r = rn;
091                                                } else {
092                                                        // rp.val > rn.val, p' root becomes the parent of n's root
093                                                        join(rn, rp);
094                                                        r = rp;
095                                                }
096                                        }
097                                }       
098                                //else: the neighbor is in no forest, i.e. unprocessed so we don't care
099                                n = p.getNextNeighbor();
100                        }
101                }
102                
103                return r;
104        }
105        
106        /**
107         *  Joins the disjoint trees with root nodes r1 and r2.
108         *  Makes the tree rooted at r1 a sub-tree under root r2, i.e.,
109         *  r1 becomes a child node of r2. Node r2 is the root of
110         *  the joined tree.
111         *  
112         * @param r1 the root of the first (child) sub-tree
113         * @param r2 the root of the second (master) sub-tree
114         */
115        private void join(Component<T> r1, Component<T> r2) {
116                r1.setParent(r2);
117                r2.addChild(r1);
118                r2.addToSize(r1.getSize());
119                r2.setHeight(Math.max(r2.getHeight(), r1.getHeight() + 1));
120        }
121        
122        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
123        
124        /**
125         * Builds the tree starting at the {@link #root} component.
126         */
127        private void buildTree() {
128                // Find all extremal regions and connect them:
129                linkExtremalComponents(root, root);     // fills components
130                //components.addAll(linkExtremalComponents2(root, root));
131                
132                // Reduce the remaining (non-extremal) components
133                // into the associated (ancestor) extremal components:
134                for (Component<T> c : components) {
135                        reduceNonExtremalComponents(c);
136                }
137        }
138        
139        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
140        
141        /**
142         * Recursively links extremal components by omitting intermediate
143         * non-extremal components. Initially applied to the root component.
144         * Collects extremal regions into {@link #components}.
145         * @param c the current component (to be inspected)
146         * @param e the closest extremal component on the ancestor path
147         */
148        private void linkExtremalComponents(Component<T> c, Component<T> e) {
149                if (c.isExtremal()) {
150                        components.add(c);
151                        //System.out.println("          adding " + c.toString() + " extremalRegions.size()=" + extremalRegions.size());
152                        if (c != e) {
153                                c.setParent(e);
154                                e.addChild(c);  // children is a HashSet, i.e., no duplicate entries!
155                        }
156                        e = c;
157                }
158                // do the same for all children
159                for (Component<T> child : new ArrayList<>(c.getChildren())) {// copy needed since recursive call may change the child list
160                        linkExtremalComponents(child, e);
161                }
162        }
163        
164        // Version 2: returns a set of extremal components (book version)
165        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
166        private Collection<Component<T>> linkExtremalComponents2(Component<T> c, Component<T> e) {
167                Collection<Component<T>> E = new LinkedList<>();
168                if (c.isExtremal()) {
169                        E.add(c);
170                        //System.out.println("          adding " + c.toString() + " extremalRegions.size()=" + extremalRegions.size());
171                        if (c != e) {
172                                c.setParent(e);
173                                e.addChild(c);  // children is a HashSet, i.e., no duplicate entries!
174                        }
175                        e = c;
176                }
177                // do the same for all children
178                for (Component<T> child : new ArrayList<>(c.getChildren())) {// copy needed since recursive call may change the child list
179                        E.addAll(linkExtremalComponents2(child, e));
180                }
181                return E;
182        }
183        
184        /**
185         * Eliminates all non-extremal components attached to the given component.
186         * Initially invoked on an extremal component.
187         * All local pixels from a non-extremal child components are collected
188         * and merged to the parent component.
189         * @param c an extremal component
190         */
191        private void reduceNonExtremalComponents(Component<T> c) {
192                if (!c.getChildren().isEmpty()) {               
193                        // visit each child and (if not extremal) collect all its points into c
194                        Iterator<Component<T>> iter = c.getChildren().iterator();
195                        while (iter.hasNext()) {
196                                Component<T> cc = iter.next();
197                                if (!cc.isExtremal()) {
198                                        reduceNonExtremalComponents(cc);                // recursive call
199                                        c.getLocalPixels().addAll(cc.getLocalPixels());
200                                        cc.getLocalPixels().clear();
201                                        iter.remove();  // remove child from c's children
202                                }
203                        }
204                }
205        }
206                
207        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
208        
209        /**
210         * This nested class represents a 2D container for elements of type {@link Component}.
211         * The array is of the same size as the image, with one component for every image pixel.
212         * The array is initially empty, i.e. contains only {@code null} values.
213         * Components are created on demand (by {@link #makeComponent(Pixel)} during building
214         * of the component tree.
215         * The method {@link #getComponent(Pixel)} is used to check if the component for
216         * a specific image point exists.
217
218         * @param <T> the type of data that may be attached to components (e.g., {@link MserData})
219         */
220        private static class ComponentMap<T> implements Iterable<Component<T>> {
221                
222                private final int width, height;
223                private final Object[] compArr;
224                
225                public ComponentMap(int width, int height) {
226                        this.width = width;
227                        this.height = height;
228                        this.compArr = new Object[this.width * this.height];
229                }
230                
231                /**
232                 * Creates and returns a new component for the specified image point.
233                 * An exception is thrown if a component already exists for this
234                 * point.
235                 * @param p the image point
236                 * @return the new component
237                 */
238                public Component<T> makeComponent(Pixel p) {
239                        int idx = width * p.y + p.x;
240                        if (compArr[idx] != null) {
241                                throw new RuntimeException("component already exists for point " + ((PntInt)p).toString());
242                        }
243                        Component<T> c = new Component<>(p.val, idx);   // new Component<>(p.val);
244                        c.addPoint(p);
245                        compArr[idx] = c;
246                        return c;
247                }
248                
249                /**
250                 * Returns the component for the specified image point or
251                 * {@code null} if it does not exist.
252                 * @param p the image point
253                 * @return the associated component or {@code null}
254                 */
255                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
256                public Component<T> getComponent(Pixel p) {
257                        return (Component<T>) compArr[p.y * width + p.x];
258                }
259                
260                /**
261                 * Iterator to loop over all {@link Component} elements of this {@link ComponentMap}.
262                 * Note that this iterator may return null elements!
263                 */
264                @Override
265                public Iterator<Component<T>> iterator() {
266                        return new Iterator<Component<T>>() {
267                                private int pos = 0;
268
269                                @Override
270                                public boolean hasNext() {
271                                        return pos < compArr.length;
272                                }
273
274                                @Override
275                                public Component<T> next() {
276                                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
277                                        Component<T> c = (Component<T>) compArr[pos];
278                                        pos++;
279                                        return c;
280                                }
281                        };
282                }
283
284        }
285        
286}
